title: Friendly un-cliched font...
content:
Hello all,

I'm looking for a friendly font that isn't the usual 'kiddy' looking style. What I mean is maybe some subtleties with ascenders etc that give it a softer more welcoming feel. It would be sitting next to a circular logo if that helps!

Many thanks! :)
author: monkey.butter

comments.content: I recently licensed [Vista](http://web.archive.org/web/20150125225741/http:/www.emigre.com/EF.php?fid=200) by [Xavier Dupré](http://web.archive.org/web/20150125225741/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Xavier%20Dupr%C3%A9) after seeing it used extensively in a local magazine. It isn't your usual square sans in that the alternates and the italics are warm and friendly. Used judiciously I think the font maintains its edgy appeal without being staid or pretentious.
Can you describe what you mean by "subtleties with ascenders"? Perhaps list some other fonts you've considered and why they do or don't work?

I just purchased Vista and used it for an informtion graphics job. Vista helped take the bite out of otherwise boring information.
